node.excerpt:
Create a repository on github If you don’t already have an account on GitHub, create one. For me, my username is
jeffrafter. You can sign up for a free account and still host your
blog. Note: by default, your username will be part of the URL for your blog. We can change
that later. Next, create a new repository and name the repository . For me, I’ve
named mine .  Build and push Once you’ve created the repository you need to add it as an  to your local copy: Again, using GitHub Desktop can simplify pushing code as it manages
your login.  Pull requests and branches  Custom domains
